channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #164 - Padre is now on GitHub
item.description:
Hi,

I am impressed that the relatively small 'Swiss Perl Workshop' is still getting reports. I wish people attending other Perl events were that enthusiastic as well. Was this the weather? (which apparently is the 'topic of the week'), or have they just received too much chocolate?

Anyway, enjoy your week! ~szabgab
item.dc:subject: list of tags?

item.title: Padre is now on Github
item.description: After a long long waiting period, finally Kaare Rasmussen stepped up and JFDI-ed. Using some earlier preparations by Kevin Dawson he converted the Padre repository that had about 100 separate projects in it, into 100 GitHub repositories. There is still a lot to do around the move, but we have already seen some activities around the repositories. It is a great opportunity to revive this project that has been almost dormant for 2 years.

item.title: Parsing: a timeline
item.description: Jeffrey Kegler writes about the history of parsing things and how it got to Marpa.

item.title: Get a weather report at the terminal with Perl
item.description: David Farrell explains how to us WWW::Wunderground.::API to find out what os the weather like in New York. Down to the hour.

item.title: Leveraging the Forecast.io API
item.description: Apparently Dave Jacoby is also interested what's the weather like, but he used a different source for his information. He directly talks to the web API using LWP::UserAgent and JSON.

item.title: Thoughts on craftsmanship: Worth Striving For
item.description: As usual, Buddy Burden provides excellent explanation why it is good for business to let your employees enjoy what they do and be proud of their work.

item.title: What Do You Want Your YAPC To Be?
item.description: Daisuke Maki (Lestrrat) who organized YAPC::Asia in the past 6 years (or so) gives his thoughts on what was the goal of YAPC::Asia and how it can attract 1,300 attendees? see also reddit.

item.title: If your core perl documentation uses =encoding, please test the new perldoc release
item.description: You don't want perldoc to break your code, do you? Mark Allen is asking you to make sure the next release won't break it either.

item.title: Some new MetaCPAN features
item.description: Get the documentation in EPUB or MOBI format; Show more than 20 results at a time. If you are a CPAN author, have an overview of your modules in dashboard.

item.title: Invite Me (Virtually) To Your Next Perl Meetup
item.description: Jeffrey Ryan Thalhammer, author of Perl::Critic and Pinto has started to give on-line presentations to Perl Monger groups. A nice experiment. Try it!

item.title: Maintaining Perl 5: Grant Report for Month 13
item.description: Tony Cook reports

item.title: More Perl::Lint Progress
item.description: Taiki Kawakami is working on a new static analyzer for Perl 5.

item.title: Outreach Program for Women: Intern's Summary
item.description: Pattawan Kaewduangdee finished her Summer project on MetaCPAN with a visit to YAPC::Asia. This is her report to TPF.

item.title: September 2014 Grant Proposals
item.description: TPF has received 5 grant proposal and is now waiting for your input. You can ask questions or just let them know what do you think.

item.title: The Perl Roadmap
item.description: An opinion on the discussion form last week by Augie De Blieck Jr.

item.title: Growing Perl Developers
item.description: In this talk Nicholas Perez describes how they hire senior level programmers without any Perl background and turn them into Perl programmers. (25 min talk, 25 min QA)

item.title: DTrace War Stories
item.description: Shawn Moore described how he used DTrace as a last resort finding the source of some really strange issues. (20 min talk)

item.title: How to get the index of specific element (value) of an array?
item.description: Using grep, List::MoreUtils::first_index and a temporary hash.

item.title: How to sort a hash of hashes by value?
item.description: You can't really sort a hash, can you? So how could you sort a HoH, a Hash of Hashes?

item.title: 2014 Swiss Perl Workshop redux
item.description: brian d foy writes about his experience, and the human aspect that needs to go into any project if we want it to be successful.

item.title: Perl 6 â€“ Is it there yet?
item.description: Jussi Kinnula reports from YAPC:EU in Bulgaria

item.title: PPW 2014 Call for Talks
item.description: The Perl Foundation put out a call for talks for the Pittsburgh Perl Workshop to be held between 7-9 November, 2014. Talk submission dead-line: September 26th. - I am glad TPF takes a bit more active role in the promotion of some of the Perl events, though I am not sure what made PPW special about it? I don't recall announcements of any other Perl Workshop. Not even YAPC::NA.

item.title: #clujpm is back in town on Nov 13th 2014 - Call for Speakers
Perl-related events
item.description: In the following cities: Hancock (NY/USA), Itapema (SC/Brasil), Salzburg (Austria), Barcelona (Spain), London (UK)
